1.parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Nominative Neuter Singular
1.str2: Who, which, what, why. Probably emphatic of tis; an interrogative pronoun, who, which or what.
Therefore, then. Apparently a primary word; certainly, or accordingly.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From peri; superabundant or superior; by implication, excessive; adverbially violently; neuter preeminence.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Jewish. From Iouda; Judaean, i.e. Belonging to Jehudah.
Or, than. A primary particle of distinction between two connected terms; disjunctive, or; comparative, than.

1.parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Nominative Feminine Singular
1.str2: Who, which, what, why. Probably emphatic of tis; an interrogative pronoun, who, which or what.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Usefulness, profit, advantage, benefit, gain. From a derivative of the base of ophelimos; usefulness, i.e. Benefit.

2.str2: A primary particle; down, in varied relations (genitive, dative or accusative) with which it is joined).
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
From the same as trope; a turn, i.e. mode or style; figuratively, deportment or character.
First, in the first place, before, formerly. Neuter of protos as adverb; firstly.

2.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Plural
2.str2: From pistis; to have faith, i.e. Credit; by implication, to entrust.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Plur: oracles, divine responses or utterances (it can include the entire Old Testament). Neuter of logios; an utterance.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.

3.str2: Who, which, what, why. Probably emphatic of tis; an interrogative pronoun, who, which or what.
If. A primary particle of conditionality; if, whether, that, etc.

3.str2: Any one, some one, a certain one or thing. An enclitic indefinite pronoun; some or any person or object.

3.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
3.str2: To be unfaithful, disbelieve, refuse belief, prove false. From apistos; to be unbelieving, i.e. disbelieve, or disobey.

3.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Plural
3.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Unbelief, unfaithfulness, distrust. From apistos; faithlessness, i.e. disbelief, or unfaithfulness.

3.parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
3.str2: From kata and argeo; to be entirely idle, literally or figuratively.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
Faith, belief, trust, confidence; fidelity, faithfulness.

4.parse: Verb - Aorist Optative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
4.str2: A prolongation and middle voice form of a primary verb; to cause to be, i.e. to become, used with great latitude.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.

Unconcealed, true, true in fact, worthy of credit, truthful. TRUE.

All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.

According to the manner in which, in the degree that, just as, as. From kata and hos; just as, that.

4.str2: A primary verb; to 'grave', especially to write; figuratively, to describe.
A primary particle, denoting a supposition, wish, possibility or uncertainty.

4.str2: From dikaios; to render just or innocent.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.

4.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Singular
4.str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
From lego; something said; by implication, a topic, also reasoning or motive; by extension, a computation; specially, the Divine Expression.
And, even, also, namely.

4.parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 2nd Person Singular
4.str2: To conquer, be victorious, overcome, prevail, subdue. From nike; to subdue.

Injustice, unrighteousness, hurt. From adikos; injustice; morally, wrongfulness.

From oregomai; properly, desire, i.e., violent passion (justifiable) abhorrence); by implication punishment.
